summary: This document is a series of FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 requesting and approving travel and funding for an operation to locate and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss shifting the operation from Massachusetts to New Hampshire based on phone data and mention moving technical assets.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the FBI's travel and arrest operation in the Epstein investigation. Historical phone data indicates she was in New Hampshire.

events.title: Location of Maxwell's phone identified
events.description: Historical phone data indicates Ghislaine Maxwell's phone is in New Hampshire, causing the FBI operation to shift focus from Massachusetts.

events.title: Travel approval for arrest operation
events.description: FBI supervisors request and receive approval for travel, lodging, and expenses to arrest a target (Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation, with plans to possibly escort the target back to New York.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning an operation to locate and arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
Historical phone data placed Maxwell's phone in New Hampshire, shifting the operation's focus from Massachusetts.
The operation required moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
Approval was granted for travel, lodging, and expenses for approximately 3-4 FBI personnel to conduct the arrest.
The emails show coordination between the FBI New York field office and the FBIHQ Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit.
